_description: Unit collision and separation configuration - RTS-style: allow overlap while moving, gentle spreading when stopped

separation._description: Separation force parameters - RTS style: weak forces, allow significant overlap
separation._multiplier_description: Separation distance = (radius1 + radius2) * multiplier. 1.0 = units touch edges. RTS games typically allow overlap.
separation._queryRadiusMultiplier_description: Spatial query radius = unit's collision radius * this value.
separation._strengthMoving_description: Separation while moving. Very weak - allows extreme clumping during movement.
separation._strengthIdle_description: Separation when idle. Gentle spreading - not jerky adjustments.
separation._strengthArriving_description: Separation at destination. Gentle spread, not sudden explosion.
separation._strengthCombat_description: Separation during combat. Minimal - units should focus on attacking, not spreading.
separation._maxForce_description: Maximum separation force. Low cap prevents jerky movement.
separation._flyingMultiplier_description: Flying unit separation multiplier. Slightly stronger for air units.

physics._description: Physics pushing - only for hard overlaps, should be rare
physics._pushRadius_description: Distance for physics push. Smaller = only push when really overlapping.
physics._pushStrength_description: Push force. Gentle - slide apart, don't bounce.
physics._pushFalloff_description: How quickly push falls off. Higher = faster falloff, less bouncy.
physics._overlapPush_description: Extra push when overlapping. Much gentler than before.

idle._description: Idle behavior - RTS style: only spread when really overlapping, very slowly
idle._separationThreshold_description: Minimum force to move idle unit. High = ignore small overlaps, feel settled.
idle._repelSpeedMultiplier_description: Speed for idle spreading. Very slow = smooth, not jittery.
idle._settleThreshold_description: Units stop adjusting when at this fraction of ideal separation distance.

combat._description: Combat movement - minimal spreading, focus on attacking
combat._spreadSpeedMultiplier_description: Speed when spreading in combat. Slow to maintain formation.
combat._separationThreshold_description: High threshold - don't spread for minor overlaps during combat.

arrival._description: Arrival spreading - gentle fan-out at destination
arrival._spreadRadius_description: Distance where arrival spreading kicks in. Smaller = spread closer to target.
arrival._spreadStrength_description: Arrival spread multiplier. Gentle boost, not explosion.

defaults._description: Default collision radius when not in assets.json

buildingAvoidance._description: Building avoidance - ONLY used for flying units or when crowd unavailable. Ground units using crowd trust the navmesh.
buildingAvoidance._strength_description: Base avoidance force. Lower than before since navmesh handles most routing now.
buildingAvoidance._hardMargin_description: Hard collision margin around buildings (world units). Wider to prevent clipping.
buildingAvoidance._softMargin_description: Soft avoidance zone for early steering (world units). Wider for smoother turning.
buildingAvoidance._predictionLookahead_description: How far ahead to predict collisions (seconds). Longer for earlier reaction.
buildingAvoidance._predictiveStrengthMultiplier_descriptio: Predictive avoidance strength as fraction of base. Lower = less orbiting.

stuck._description: Stuck detection and resolution - helps units escape when blocked. Less aggressive with navmesh routing.
stuck._detectionFrames_description: Frames of no movement before unit is considered stuck. Longer to avoid false positives.
stuck._velocityThreshold_description: Speed below which unit might be stuck. Lower threshold for more accurate detection.
stuck._nudgeStrength_description: Force applied to nudge stuck units. Gentler since navmesh handles most routing.
stuck._minDistanceToTarget_description: Don't apply stuck detection if closer than this to target. Wider to prevent false nudges at destination.
stuck._tangentialBias_description: How much to nudge tangentially vs toward target. Lower = more toward target, avoids random walks.
